DataElement.preferredName: Investigator Study Site Research Personnel Role Effective Date and Time Range ISO21090.IVL.TS.DATETIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A researcher at a study site who oversees multiple aspects of the study at a site, including protocol submission for IRB approval, participant recruitment, informed consent, data collection, and analysis. The date and time span for when the study site personnel is active.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Investigator Study Site Research Personnel Role Effective Date and Time Range
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.:A facility in which study/protocol activities are conducted.:People engaged in research.:The usual or expected function of something; the part something plays in an action or event._Existing in fact and ready for service.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.
